title: How to Make Vegan Tacos

steps.headline: Drizzle the oil over a medium-sized skillet on medium heat.
Add the onion and only a pinch of salt.
steps.description: Stir for about 10-15 minutes. The onions should be brown and soft.

steps.headline: Add in the garlic and mix again for about a minute.
Stir in the cumin, cocoa powder, and the rest of the salt.
steps.description: Mix for about thirty seconds with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Add the hot sauce, juice of one lime, and beans.
steps.description: Mix again and bring the mixture to a simmer.

steps.headline: Simmer the mixture for about 10-15 minutes, stirring every few minutes.
steps.description: Add additional salt or hot sauce if desired. The mixture will begin to thicken but there will be some liquid left. Set aside.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to a broil.
Place the tortillas on a large baking sheet and spoon the bean mixture onto each one.
Toast the tacos in the oven for about 2-3 minutes.
steps.description: Lift the tacos every few seconds to avoid them from burning or crisping.

steps.headline: Remove the baking sheet from the oven.
steps.description: Allow the tacos to cool off for about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Garnish the tacos with shaved onions, chopped cilantro, salsa, or chipotle. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Remove any excess water from the tofu.
steps.description: Place the tofu slices on a stack of paper towels. Stack with more paper towels and place a heavy skillet on top of it. Allow all the tofu water to come out; it'll take about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Mix the cilantro, radishes, coleslaw, a tablespoon of oil, lime zest, and half of the lime juice in a large bowl.
steps.description: Toss well until fully combined together.

steps.headline: Beat the vegan yogurt and the rest of the lime juice together in a small bowl.
steps.description: Season with a desired amount of salt and pepper.

steps.headline: Brush the rest of the olive oil over the tofu strips and sprinkle over the taco seasoning.
Cook the tofu strip on an iron skillet over medium-high heat.
steps.description: Cook for about 7 minutes, flipping after 2 minutes, to allow the tofu to crisp slightly.

steps.headline: Remove the tofu from the heat and slice it into strips.
Toast the tortillas on the stovetop and heat until warm.
Serve.
steps.description: Stuff the tacos with the tofu, coleslaw mixture, and vegan cheese. Drizzle over the vegan yogurt mixture and salsa. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 400˚ Fahrenheit or 204˚ Celsius.
Toss all the vegetables, except the avocado, with the oil, garlic, cumin, and salt.
Roast the vegetables in the oven for about 20-25 minutes.
steps.description: The vegetables should be brown.

steps.headline: Beat the vegan yogurt, avocado, lime juice, and cilantro together in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Blend well until well-combined and the mixture is creamy.

steps.headline: Toast the tortillas on the stovetop and heat until warm.
Serve.
steps.description: Stuff the tacos with the roasted vegetables and avocado cream sauce. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 425˚ Fahrenheit or 218˚ Celsius.
Grease a baking tray with non-stick greasing spray.
Whisk the dry ingredients and milk.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine the flour, ½ cup milk, 1 teaspoon onion powder, garlic powder, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Mix until fully combined.

steps.headline: Remove the leaves and stems off the cauliflower.
steps.description: Break into pieces.

steps.headline: Add the cauliflower into the flour mixture and toss well.
Place the coated cauliflower on the baking tray and spread around.
Bake for about 30 minutes until slightly roasted and remove from heat.
Pour the buffalo sauce all over the cauliflower.
steps.description: Toss well until fully coated.

steps.headline: Bake the cauliflower for an additional 10 minutes.
Make the sauce.
steps.description: Blend the avocado, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, ¼ cup milk, ½ teaspoon onion powder, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper in a food processor. Blend until well-combined.

steps.headline: Toast the tortillas on the stovetop and heat until warm.
Serve.
steps.description: Stuff the tacos with the buffalo cauliflower and the rest of the taco toppings. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Drizzle the oil over a large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add only a half cup of the red onion and saute for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Cook until the onions are soft.

steps.headline: Stir in the tomato paste, garlic, taco seasoning, and dried lentils.
steps.description: Saute for an additional 30 seconds.

steps.headline: Pour in the broth and allow the mixture to boil over the medium heat.
steps.description: Let it boil uncovered for about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Turn down the heat to medium-low and cover with a lid.
steps.description: Let the lentils simmer for about 5 minutes until tender.

steps.headline: Bring the water to a boil and add the bulgur in a small saucepan.
Turn down the heat to low and cover the saucepan.
steps.description: Allow it to simmer for about 12-15 minutes until it's tender.

steps.headline: Pour the cooked bulgur into the lentils.
steps.description: Mix well with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Make the avocado sauce in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Mash the avocados with the rest of the red onion, cherry tomatoes, lime juice, and cilantro leaves. Mash until fully combined.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Stuff the tacos with the lentil mixture and top it off with avocado sauce. Enjoy!

text: Black Bean Vegan Tacos Drizzle the oil over a medium-sized skillet on medium heat.  Add the onion and only a pinch of salt. Stir for about 10-15 minutes. The onions should be brown and soft. Add in the garlic and mix again for about a minute.  Stir in the cumin, cocoa powder, and the rest of the salt. Mix for about thirty seconds with a wooden spoon. Add the hot sauce, juice of one lime, and beans. Mix again and bring the mixture to a simmer. Simmer the mixture for about 10-15 minutes, stirring every few minutes. Add additional salt or hot sauce if desired. The mixture will begin to thicken but there will be some liquid left. Set aside. Preheat the oven to a broil.  Place the tortillas on a large baking sheet and spoon the bean mixture onto each one.  Toast the tacos in the oven for about 2-3 minutes. Lift the tacos every few seconds to avoid them from burning or crisping. Remove the baking sheet from the oven. Allow the tacos to cool off for about 10 minutes. Serve. Garnish the tacos with shaved onions, chopped cilantro, salsa, or chipotle. Enjoy! Tofu Vegan Tacos Remove any excess water from the tofu. Place the tofu slices on a stack of paper towels. Stack with more paper towels and place a heavy skillet on top of it. Allow all the tofu water to come out; it'll take about 10 minutes. Mix the cilantro, radishes, coleslaw, a tablespoon of oil, lime zest, and half of the lime juice in a large bowl. Toss well until fully combined together. Beat the vegan yogurt and the rest of the lime juice together in a small bowl. Season with a desired amount of salt and pepper. Brush the rest of the olive oil over the tofu strips and sprinkle over the taco seasoning.  Cook the tofu strip on an iron skillet over medium-high heat. Cook for about 7 minutes, flipping after 2 minutes, to allow the tofu to crisp slightly. Remove the tofu from the heat and slice it into strips.  Toast the tortillas on the stovetop and heat until warm.  Serve. Stuff the tacos with the tofu, coleslaw mixture, and vegan cheese. Drizzle over the vegan yogurt mixture and salsa. Enjoy! Grilled Vegetable Vegan Tacos Preheat oven to 400˚ Fahrenheit or 204˚ Celsius.  Toss all the vegetables, except the avocado, with the oil, garlic, cumin, and salt.  Roast the vegetables in the oven for about 20-25 minutes. The vegetables should be brown. Beat the vegan yogurt, avocado, lime juice, and cilantro together in a separate bowl. Blend well until well-combined and the mixture is creamy. Toast the tortillas on the stovetop and heat until warm.  Serve. Stuff the tacos with the roasted vegetables and avocado cream sauce. Enjoy! Buffalo Vegan Tacos Preheat oven to 425˚ Fahrenheit or 218˚ Celsius.  Grease a baking tray with non-stick greasing spray.  Whisk the dry ingredients and milk. In a large bowl, combine the flour, ½ cup milk, 1 teaspoon onion powder, garlic powder, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Mix until fully combined. Remove the leaves and stems off the cauliflower. Break into pieces. Add the cauliflower into the flour mixture and toss well.  Place the coated cauliflower on the baking tray and spread around.  Bake for about 30 minutes until slightly roasted and remove from heat.  Pour the buffalo sauce all over the cauliflower. Toss well until fully coated. Bake the cauliflower for an additional 10 minutes.  Make the sauce. Blend the avocado, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, ¼ cup milk, ½ teaspoon onion powder, ¼ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper in a food processor. Blend until well-combined. Toast the tortillas on the stovetop and heat until warm.  Serve. Stuff the tacos with the buffalo cauliflower and the rest of the taco toppings. Enjoy! Lentil Vegan Tacos Drizzle the oil over a large skillet on medium-high heat.  Add only a half cup of the red onion and saute for 5 minutes. Cook until the onions are soft. Stir in the tomato paste, garlic, taco seasoning, and dried lentils. Saute for an additional 30 seconds. Pour in the broth and allow the mixture to boil over the medium heat. Let it boil uncovered for about 10 minutes. Turn down the heat to medium-low and cover with a lid. Let the lentils simmer for about 5 minutes until tender. Bring the water to a boil and add the bulgur in a small saucepan.  Turn down the heat to low and cover the saucepan. Allow it to simmer for about 12-15 minutes until it's tender. Pour the cooked bulgur into the lentils. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Make the avocado sauce in a separate bowl. Mash the avocados with the rest of the red onion, cherry tomatoes, lime juice, and cilantro leaves. Mash until fully combined. Serve. Stuff the tacos with the lentil mixture and top it off with avocado sauce. Enjoy!
